events.name: IoT Seminar: How Developers Can Get the Most Out of IoT Standards and Tool.
events.description:
The seminar is presented by the Open Mobile Alliance (OMA) in conjunction with #IOTSG on Wednesday, October 26, 2016in Singapore and will feature a variety of local and international speakers from Standards Settings bodies and companies with major influence in the IoT space. **************************************************************  ************************************************************** This developer-focused event will provide an overview of industry standards and tools that are enabling interoperability and market growth in the Internet of Things. Highlights of the event will include a demo and presentation of the Microsoft Azure platform, the ARM mbed platform, an overview of IoT developments in the automotive space and more. International and local speakers will share valuable insights for developers active in IoT.  ################################################## NOTE: This is a paid event, however IOTSG members will enjoy 30% discount.  Use  "IOTSG" code. For details : Please signup here. ################################################## 


</a>  The event will be moderated by <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/ckvishwakarma">C K Vishwakarma, Founder of IOTSG & ATCAlliance.  Highlights of the event will include live demos and presentations from- </a> <a href="http://openmobilealliance.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/alex_pic-copy.jpg"> </a> <a href="http://openmobilealliance.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/alex_pic-copy.jpg">  Alex Edelmann, Software Architect, Bosch, Singapore –Practical Applications of the Vorto Device Abstraction and Code Shah, Head of R&D, IOT Business Unit, Nokia –Importance of Use of Standards and Protocol Validation Services </a>  <a href="https://fr.linkedin.com/in/hatem-oueslati-646b6">Hatem Oueslati, CEO and Co-Founder, IOTEROP -Security, Interoperability and Remote Device Management in IoT: How LWM2M can meet the Challenge of Tomorrow’s Industries and Smart Cities </a> <a href="http://openmobilealliance.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Jong-Young-copy.jpg"> </a> <a href="http://openmobilealliance.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Jong-Young-copy.jpg">  Jong-Young Lee, Director, R&D Group, MDS Technology -NEO-IDM(New IOT Device management) platform based on LWM2M protocol </a> <a href="http://openmobilealliance.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Juan-Perez.jpg"> </a> <a and oneM2M for Developers </a> <a href="http://openmobilealliance.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Tao-Lin-of-Movimento.jpg"> </a> <a For details : Please signup here. </a> ************************************************************** VENUE: Millennium Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel - 392 Havelock Road, Singapore,[masked] -<a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/oma-seminar-how-developers-can-get-the-most-out-of-iot-standards-and-tools-tickets-26668492178?ref=ebtn#map-target">View Map **************************************************************  **************************************************************  Note: Please note that photography and videography will be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organisations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data.
